article:
Students' life in America
Students in America always have a busy but wonderful school day.
They have classes for five days each week. From _ to Friday students usually get up at seven. Then they wash their faces and have _ . They usually have eggs, bacon , bread, fruit and a glass of milk. After that they go to school on foot or by yellow school _ .Some students ride bikes. They get to school at about half past eight. Then they put their school bags in their lockers and _ only one book, a notebook and a pencil to each class. In a middle school, students have classes for six hours. Their classes are English, Writing, Maths, Music, _ and so on .
At noon students don't go home for lunch. They _ have lunch at school. They often have meat, fruit, _ , bread and a drink. _ most students like pizza, hot dogs and hamburgers better. Students don't have a short _ .They go back to have classes _ lunch until three o'clock. Then they go home.
Students don't do their homework after they get home. They usually play or watch TV before _ . They have _ at six in the evening. The supper usually has soup, meat, vegetables, rice or pasta . After supper they do their _ . Sometimes they play or talk with their parents at home.
